intro: Drosanthemum zygophylloides, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often resembling daisies. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Drosanthemum zygophylloides is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
